title: Embedded Systems Engineer
description: Design and develop the embedded firmware and sensor interfaces for AroBag's smart monitoring hardware. You'll work at the intersection of medical device engineering and IoT, building reliable, real-time data acquisition systems for clinical environments.
requirements: 3+ years experience in embedded C/C++ development
Experience with sensor integration and signal processing
Familiarity with medical device standards (IEC 62304) is a plus
Strong debugging and hardware-software integration skills

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Build and deploy the predictive models that power AroBag's AKI and CKD detection engine. You'll work with clinical time-series data, develop real-time inference pipelines, and collaborate closely with our clinical advisory team.
requirements: 2+ years experience building ML models for time-series or healthcare data
Proficiency in Python and frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow
Experience with model deployment and edge inference is a plus
Interest in clinical AI and regulatory requirements for SaMD

title: Clinical Research Associate
description: Support the design and execution of AroBag's clinical validation studies. You'll coordinate with hospital partners, manage trial documentation, and help build the evidence base for regulatory submissions.
requirements: Background in life sciences, biomedical engineering, or clinical research
Experience with clinical trial protocols and regulatory documentation
Strong communication skills for hospital and clinician engagement
Familiarity with CDSCO or FDA regulatory pathways is a plus

title: Full-Stack Developer
description: Build the companion app and clinical dashboard that connects AroBag to hospital systems. You'll develop the mobile app, web dashboard, and EMR integration layer that delivers real-time alerts to clinicians.
requirements: 3+ years full-stack experience (React/React Native + Node.js or similar)
Experience with real-time data systems and APIs
Interest in healthcare technology and HL7/FHIR standards
Bonus: experience with computer vision or mobile camera integration
